What is the purpose of the `getcurrencystate` command in Verus?

The `getcurrencystate` command is used to retrieve the current state of a specific currency on the blockchain. It can return the latest currency state and height, or it can be used to retrieve the currency state at a specific height or range of heights.

getcurrencystate "currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedsystemid")

Returns the currency state(s) on the blockchain for any specified currency, either with all changes on this chain or relative to another system.

Arguments
  "currencynameorid"         (string)         name or i-address of currency in question  "n" or "m,n" or "m,n,o"     (int or string, optional) height or inclusive range with optional step at which to get the currency state
                                  If not specified, the latest currency state and height is returned
  ("connectedchainid")        (string)         optional

Result:
  [
    {
      "height": n,
      "blocktime": n,
      "currencystate": {
        "flags" : n,
        "initialratio" : n,
        "initialsupply" : n,
        "emitted" : n,
        "supply" : n,
        "reserve" : n,
        "currentratio" : n,
      "}
    },
  ]

Examples:
> verus getcurrencystate "currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedchainid")
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencystate", "params": ["currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedchainid")] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getcurrencystate
How do I specify the currency I want to retrieve the state for using the `getcurrencystate` command?
You can specify the currency by providing its name or i-address as the first argument to the `getcurrencystate` command.

getcurrencystate "currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedsystemid")

Returns the currency state(s) on the blockchain for any specified currency, either with all changes on this chain or relative to another system.

Arguments

What is the optional "n" argument for in the `getcurrencystate` command?
The optional "n" argument is used to specify the height or range of heights at which to retrieve the currency state. If not specified, the command will return the latest currency state and height.

getcurrencystate "currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedsystemid")

Returns the currency state(s) on the blockchain for any specified currency, either with all changes on this chain or relative to another system.

Arguments

                                  If not specified, the latest currency state and height is returned

What is the optional "connectedsystemid" argument for in the `getcurrencystate` command?
The optional "connectedsystemid" argument is used to specify the ID of a connected system relative to which the currency state should be retrieved.

getcurrencystate "currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedsystemid")

Returns the currency state(s) on the blockchain for any specified currency, either with all changes on this chain or relative to another system.

Arguments
  "currencynameorid"         (string)         name or i-address of currency in question  "n" or "m,n" or "m,n,o"     (int or string, optional) height or inclusive range with optional step at which to get the currency state
                                  If not specified, the latest currency state and height is returned
  ("connectedchainid")        (string)         optional

What information is returned by the `getcurrencystate` command?

The `getcurrencystate` command returns an array of objects, each containing information about the currency state at a specific height. The information includes the height, block time, flags, initial ratio, initial supply, emitted amount, total supply, reserve amount, and current ratio of the currency.

getcurrencystate "currencynameorid" ("n") ("connectedsystemid")

Returns the currency state(s) on the blockchain for any specified currency, either with all changes on this chain or relative to another system.

Arguments
  "currencynameorid"         (string)         name or i-address of currency in question  "n" or "m,n" or "m,n,o"     (int or string, optional) height or inclusive range with optional step at which to get the currency state
                                  If not specified, the latest currency state and height is returned
  ("connectedchainid")        (string)         optional
